draw.overall_supervision_plan: This is a living document. Newly identified risks will be recorded and mitigated accordingly and risk acceptance will be approved at the appropriate level.The OIC, RSO, and range leadership will conduct a range safety brief prior to all live fire training. The OIC and RSO are overall responsible for safety. However, team leaders, squad leaders, and safeties have the responsibility to be actively engaged in range activities and Soldier actions so as to mitigate risk at the lowest level possible and ensure overall safety for the training event. Range OIC all first line supervisors are responsible for all actions on the range. Vehicle movement will be restricted on the range once Soldiers are dismounted. All vehicles will be ground guided and parked in designated area. Troops are briefed on the route, travel speed, trail distance, fire drills, roll over drills, communication plan and vehicle safety prior to SP. CASEVAC Vehicle (Arranged by Range OIC) is on sight.
